verses.text: If there be therefore any consolation in Christ, if any comfort of love, if any fellowship of the Spirit, if any bowels and mercies,
Fulfil ye my joy, that ye be likeminded, having the same love, being of one accord, of one mind.

similars.text: This is my commandment, That ye love one another, as I have loved you.
A new commandment I give unto you, That ye love one another; as I have loved you, that ye also love one another.

verses.text: Let nothing be done through strife or vainglory; but in lowliness of mind let each esteem other better than themselves.

similars.text: Let us not be desirous of vain glory, provoking one another, envying one another.
Be of the same mind one toward another. Mind not high things, but condescend to men of low estate. Be not wise in your own conceits.

verses.text: Look not every man on his own things, but every man also on the things of others.

similars.text: Let no man seek his own, but every man another's wealth.

verses.text: Let this mind be in you, which was also in Christ Jesus:
Who, being in the form of God, thought it not robbery to be equal with God:
But made himself of no reputation, and took upon him the form of a servant, and was made in the likeness of men:
And being found in fashion as a man, he humbled himself, and became obedient unto death, even the death of the cross.
Wherefore God also hath highly exalted him, and given him a name which is above every name:

similars.text: For thou, Lord, art high above all the earth: thou art exalted far above all gods.
Who opposeth and exalteth himself above all that is called God, or that is worshipped; so that he as God sitteth in the temple of God, shewing himself that he is God.
And the multitudes that went before, and that followed, cried, saying, Hosanna to the Son of David: Blessed is he that cometh in the name of the Lord; Hosanna in the highest.

verses.text: That at the name of Jesus every knee should bow, of things in heaven, and things in earth, and things under the earth;

similars.text: For it is written, As I live, saith the Lord, every knee shall bow to me, and every tongue shall confess to God.

verses.text: And that every tongue should confess that Jesus Christ is Lord, to the glory of God the Father.

similars.text: Whosoever shall confess that Jesus is the Son of God, God dwelleth in him, and he in God.
That ye may with one mind and one mouth glorify God, even the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ.
That ye may with one mind and one mouth glorify God, even the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ.

verses.text: Wherefore, my beloved, as ye have always obeyed, not as in my presence only, but now much more in my absence, work out your own salvation with fear and trembling.

similars.text: Servants, be obedient to them that are your masters according to the flesh, with fear and trembling, in singleness of your heart, as unto Christ;
And now, my beloved brethren, I desire that ye should remember these things, and that ye should work out your salvation with fear before God, and that ye should no more deny the coming of Christ;
Serve the Lord with fear, and rejoice with trembling.

verses.text: For it is God which worketh in you both to will and to do of his good pleasure.

similars.text: Make you perfect in every good work to do his will, working in you that which is wellpleasing in his sight, through Jesus Christ; to whom be glory for ever and ever. Amen.
Verily I say unto you, ye shall both have according to your desires, for ye both joy in that which ye have desired.
Is it any pleasure to the Almighty, that thou art righteous? or is it gain to him, that thou makest thy ways perfect?
And we have confidence in the Lord touching you, that ye both do and will do the things which we command you.
In every thing give thanks: for this is the will of God in Christ Jesus concerning you.
I delight to do thy will, O my God: yea, thy law is within my heart.
For it is better, if the will of God be so, that ye suffer for well doing, than for evil doing.
Jesus saith unto them, My meat is to do the will of him that sent me, and to finish his work.
Make you perfect in every good work to do his will, working in you that which is wellpleasing in his sight, through Jesus Christ; to whom be glory for ever and ever. Amen.
Wherefore also we pray always for you, that our God would count you worthy of this calling, and fulfil all the good pleasure of his goodness, and the work of faith with power:

verses.text: Do all things without murmurings and disputings:
That ye may be blameless and harmless, the sons of God, without rebuke, in the midst of a crooked and perverse nation, among whom ye shine as lights in the world;

similars.text: For ye know that there is no unrighteousness in them, and that which is righteous cometh down from above, from the Father of lights.
But ye are a chosen generation, a royal priesthood, an holy nation, a peculiar people; that ye should shew forth the praises of him who hath called you out of darkness into his marvellous light:

verses.text: Holding forth the word of life; that I may rejoice in the day of Christ, that I have not run in vain, neither laboured in vain.

similars.text: Uphold me according unto thy word, that I may live: and let me not be ashamed of my hope.
In God I will praise his word, in God I have put my trust; I will not fear what flesh can do unto me.
That ye be not soon shaken in mind, or be troubled, neither by spirit, nor by word, nor by letter as from us, as that the day of Christ is at hand.

verses.text: Yea, and if I be offered upon the sacrifice and service of your faith, I joy, and rejoice with you all.

similars.text: I know also, my God, that thou triest the heart, and hast pleasure in uprightness. As for me, in the uprightness of mine heart I have willingly offered all these things: and now have I seen with joy thy people, which are present here, to offer willingly unto thee.
I beseech you therefore, brethren, by the mercies of God, that ye present your bodies a living sacrifice, holy, acceptable unto God, which is your reasonable service.
And having this confidence, I know that I shall abide and continue with you all for your furtherance and joy of faith;

I say unto you, my brethren, that if you should render all the thanks and praise which your whole soul has power to possess, to that God who has created you, and has kept and preserved you, and has caused that ye should rejoice, and has granted that ye should live in peace one with another--
As also ye have acknowledged us in part, that we are your rejoicing, even as ye also are ours in the day of the Lord Jesus.
I will offer to thee the sacrifice of thanksgiving, and will call upon the name of the Lord.
Rejoice in the Lord alway: and again I say, Rejoice.
And my spirit hath rejoiced in God my Saviour.

verses.text: For the same cause also do ye joy, and rejoice with me.

similars.text: Rejoice in the Lord alway: and again I say, Rejoice.
Be glad in the Lord, and rejoice, ye righteous: and shout for joy, all ye that are upright in heart.
Therefore my heart is glad, and my glory rejoiceth: my flesh also shall rest in hope.
For ye are our glory and joy.

For the Lord hath heard thy prayers, and hath judged of thy righteousness, and hath sent me to declare unto thee that thou mayest rejoice; and that thou mayest declare unto thy people, that they may also be filled with joy.
And my soul shall be joyful in the Lord: it shall rejoice in his salvation.
Let them shout for joy, and be glad, that favour my righteous cause: yea, let them say continually, Let the Lord be magnified, which hath pleasure in the prosperity of his servant.
But be ye glad and rejoice for ever in that which I create: for, behold, I create Jerusalem a rejoicing, and her people a joy.

verses.text: But I trust in the Lord Jesus to send Timotheus shortly unto you, that I also may be of good comfort, when I know your state.

similars.text: Now if Timotheus come, see that he may be with you without fear: for he worketh the work of the Lord, as I also do.
But I trust in the Lord that I also myself shall come shortly.
And sent Timotheus, our brother, and minister of God, and our fellowlabourer in the gospel of Christ, to establish you, and to comfort you concerning your faith:
Let, I pray thee, thy merciful kindness be for my comfort, according to thy word unto thy servant.
Whom I have sent unto you for the same purpose, that ye might know our affairs, and that he might comfort your hearts.
That is, that I may be comforted together with you by the mutual faith both of you and me.
And sent Timotheus, our brother, and minister of God, and our fellowlabourer in the gospel of Christ, to establish you, and to comfort you concerning your faith:
Now if Timotheus come, see that he may be with you without fear: for he worketh the work of the Lord, as I also do.

verses.text: For I have no man likeminded, who will naturally care for your state.
For all seek their own, not the things which are Jesus Christ's.

similars.text: And I seek not mine own glory: there is one that seeketh and judgeth.
For we preach not ourselves, but Christ Jesus the Lord; and ourselves your servants for Jesus' sake.

verses.text: But ye know the proof of him, that, as a son with the father, he hath served with me in the gospel.

similars.text: And ye know that with all my power I have served your father.
For God is my witness, whom I serve with my spirit in the gospel of his Son, that without ceasing I make mention of you always in my prayers;
I am one that bear witness of myself, and the Father that sent me beareth witness of me.
And ye know that with all my power I have served your father.

verses.text: Him therefore I hope to send presently, so soon as I shall see how it will go with me.
But I trust in the Lord that I also myself shall come shortly.

similars.text: But I trust in the Lord Jesus to send Timotheus shortly unto you, that I also may be of good comfort, when I know your state.
Do thy diligence to come shortly unto me:
But withal prepare me also a lodging: for I trust that through your prayers I shall be given unto you.
I will also leave in the midst of thee an afflicted and poor people, and they shall trust in the name of the Lord.
For I will not see you now by the way; but I trust to tarry a while with you, if the Lord permit.
And again, be patient in tribulation until I come; and, behold, I come quickly, and my reward is with me, and they who have sought me early shall find rest to their souls. Even so. Amen.
I will say of the Lord, He is my refuge and my fortress: my God; in him will I trust.
Pray always, that ye may not faint, until I come. Behold, and lo, I will come quickly, and receive you unto myself. Amen.
And I will be your ruler when I come; and behold, I come quickly, and ye shall see that my law is kept.
For his word ye shall receive, as if from mine own mouth, in all patience and faith.
And having this confidence, I know that I shall abide and continue with you all for your furtherance and joy of faith;
And I will establish my covenant with thee; and thou shalt know that I am the Lord:
Commit thy way unto the Lord; trust also in him; and he shall bring it to pass.
I will even betroth thee unto me in faithfulness: and thou shalt know the Lord.
That thy trust may be in the Lord, I have made known to thee this day, even to thee.
And it is my will that you shall humble yourselves before me, and obtain this blessing by your diligence and humility and the prayer of faith.

verses.text: Yet I supposed it necessary to send to you Epaphroditus, my brother, and companion in labour, and fellowsoldier, but your messenger, and he that ministered to my wants.
For he longed after you all, and was full of heaviness, because that ye had heard that he had been sick.
For indeed he was sick nigh unto death: but God had mercy on him; and not on him only, but on me also, lest I should have sorrow upon sorrow.
I sent him therefore the more carefully, that, when ye see him again, ye may rejoice, and that I may be the less sorrowful.

similars.text: And ye now therefore have sorrow: but I will see you again, and your heart shall rejoice, and your joy no man taketh from you.
That your rejoicing may be more abundant in Jesus Christ for me by my coming to you again.
And not by his coming only, but by the consolation wherewith he was comforted in you, when he told us your earnest desire, your mourning, your fervent mind toward me; so that I rejoiced the more.

verses.text: Receive him therefore in the Lord with all gladness; and hold such in reputation:

similars.text: Acquaint now thyself with him, and be at peace: thereby good shall come unto thee.
He shall glorify me: for he shall receive of mine, and shall shew it unto you.
He shall receive the blessing from the Lord, and righteousness from the God of his salvation.
He that receiveth of God, let him account it of God; and let him rejoice that he is accounted of God worthy to receive.
Let them shout for joy, and be glad, that favour my righteous cause: yea, let them say continually, Let the Lord be magnified, which hath pleasure in the prosperity of his servant.
And whatsoever we ask, we receive of him, because we keep his commandments, and do those things that are pleasing in his sight.
Rejoice in the Lord, ye righteous; and give thanks at the remembrance of his holiness.
For the Lord taketh pleasure in his people: he will beautify the meek with salvation.
As ye have therefore received Christ Jesus the Lord, so walk ye in him:
The righteous shall be glad in the Lord, and shall trust in him; and all the upright in heart shall glory.
For unto him that receiveth it shall be given more abundantly, even power.
Give thanks unto the Lord, call upon his name, make known his deeds among the people.
Sing forth the honour of his name: make his praise glorious.

verses.text: Because for the work of Christ he was nigh unto death, not regarding his life, to supply your lack of service toward me.
